Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

‘Hydro-Pepper’ is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and crisp, succulent stems. Its flavour is a clean, sharp, and intense pepperiness, without the slight minerality sometimes found in soil-grown cress. This makes it an exceptionally versatile and potent garnish or salad component.

2. A Culinary Chameleon

This watercress is a foundational ingredient for adding a fresh, pungent spark to a wide array of dishes.

  • Classic Pairings: The quintessential base for peppery salads, a vibrant garnish for cold soups (like vichyssoise or gazpacho), and the perfect sharp counterpoint in sandwiches and wraps.
  • Modern Applications: Its intense flavour stands up well to blending into potent green sauces and pestos, providing a peppery backbone without the need for garlic or chili.
  • Global Cuisine: A staple in European garnishes, it also fits seamlessly into Southeast Asian dishes like Pho and Laksa, where its clean pepperiness complements aromatic broths.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The plant is designed for a ‘cut-and-come-again’ harvest. Snipping the stems just above a leaf node encourages bushy regrowth, providing a continuous yield of 20–30g of pristine, ready-to-eat greens per week from a single HydraPad™.
